tactical_doctrine.role: Panzer division defending Mareth Line sector. Division reconstituted after near-destruction at El Alamein (12 tanks November 1942). Conducted successful counterattack against 50th Division bridgehead March 22, recapturing positions, destroying 35 British tanks, capturing 200 prisoners.
special_capabilities: Skilled at mobile defense and counterattack
Mareth counterattack precision: Hit left flank 0145 hours, forced 151st Brigade back
known_issues: Severely understrength - division rebuilt after El Alamein disaster
Allied air superiority prevents daylight movement
Tank losses unsustainable - no replacements available
Supply lines from Sicily under constant air attack

historical_context.formation_date: 1940 (formed in Germany, deployed to Libya July 1941)
historical_context.operational_status: Active but severely depleted - Battle of Mareth Line (March 1943)
major_battles: Battle of Medenine (6 March 1943): Repulsed Rommel's last offensive
Battle of Mareth Line (20-26 March 1943): Counterattacked 50th Division bridgehead March 22, recaptured positions, destroyed 35 British tanks, captured 200 prisoners
